message.content:
cs.CL, cs.SI, cs.SD, cs.IR, cs.LG 

This paper deals with text representation schemes for two tasks related to social media content analysis: user aggression detection and fact detection. These tasks fall under the categories of natural language processing (NLP) and information retrieval (IR), which are covered by the sub-categories cs.CL and cs.IR. The paper also discusses the use of machine learning classifiers and deep neural networks, which are relevant to the sub-categories cs.LG and cs.SI. Finally, the paper deals with multilingual text analysis, which is related to the sub-category cs.SD. Therefore, the most likely sub-categories are cs.CL and cs.IR, followed by cs.SI, cs.LG, and cs.SD.
